Countdown:

1. An act of counting numerals backwards to zero, especially in the last seconds before the launching of a rocket or a missile.
2. The final moments before an important event and the procedures carried out during that time.

Metaphor:

1. A figure of speech in which a word or phrase is applied to an object or action to which it is not literally applicable.
2. A thing regarded as representative of pr symbolic of something else, especially something abstract.

I suppose the two aren't mutually exclusive.
